title: TC001-Authentication - Successful Login with Valid Credentials
description: Verify that users can log in successfully with correct username and password, session is established, and multi-factor authentication is enforced if enabled.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Successful! Welcome to your dashboard').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: User login verification failed. The user was not authenticated or redirected to the dashboard as expected after submitting valid credentials and completing multi-factor authentication.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC002-Authentication - Failed Login with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify that login attempts with incorrect username or password are rejected with appropriate error messages and no session is created.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Successful login to dashboard').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Login attempts with incorrect username or password should be rejected with appropriate error messages and no session should be created, but the test did not detect this failure.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-Dashboard - KPI and Chart Load Performance
description: Verify that the dashboard main page loads KPI cards, trend analytics, and recent activities within 500 milliseconds.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Dashboard Loaded Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The dashboard main page did not load KPI cards, trend analytics, and recent activities within 500 milliseconds as required by the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Multi-Tenant Data Isolation with RLS Policies
description: Verify that data accessed by a user is strictly isolated to their tenant using Row-Level Security to prevent data leaks across companies.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Tenant B Confidential Data').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Data accessed by a user is not strictly isolated to their tenant. Tenant B data should not be accessible or visible to Tenant A users, indicating a failure in Row-Level Security enforcement.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC005-Customer Management - CRUD Operations and Bulk Actions
description: Verify the customer management module supports creating, reading, updating, deleting single and multiple customers with correct data persistence.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Nonexistent Customer Record Confirmation').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The customer management module did not perform as expected. The new customer creation, editing, bulk deletion, import, or export functionalities did not succeed as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC007-Invoice Management - Payment Tracking and Kanban View
description: Verify invoice creation, editing, PDF export, payment status tracking, and kanban board visualization work correctly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Invoice Creation Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Invoice creation, editing, PDF export, payment status tracking, and kanban board visualization did not complete successfully as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC009-Real-Time Notification System Functionality
description: Verify notifications are delivered in real-time, can be marked as read, and their state is synchronized correctly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Notification received successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Notifications are not delivered in real-time, cannot be marked as read, or their state is not synchronized correctly as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC010-Localization and Language Switch
description: Verify the UI switches seamlessly between Turkish and English with correct text translations and layout adjustments.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Language switched successfully to Klingon').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The UI did not switch languages seamlessly between Turkish and English with correct text translations and layout adjustments as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow

        frame = context.pages[-1]

        if context:

            await pw.stop()

title: TC012-Workflow Automation - Quote Expiry and Deal Monitoring
description: Verify that defined workflow automations run as expected: expired quotes are marked and deal monitoring triggers alerts or status changes.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Automation executed successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The workflow automations for expired quotes and deal monitoring did not run as expected. Expected status changes and alerts were not observed.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC014-Report Generation and Export Accuracy
description: Verify that reports for customers, sales, finance, and products generate correct datasets and support export in expected formats.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Report generation successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test plan execution has failed. Reports for customers, sales, finance, and products did not generate correct datasets or exports as expected.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC016-UI Components Render Correctly on Supported Browsers and Devices
description: Verify all UI components (buttons, inputs, tables, dialogs, tabs) render correctly, are responsive, and interact as expected on supported browsers and devices.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=UI Components Rendered Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The UI components did not render correctly or respond as expected on supported browsers and devices as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC017-Performance Optimization Verification - Prefetch, Lazy Loading, Skeleton States
description: Verify prefetching of data on hover, lazy loading of components, and skeleton states display correctly during load to optimize user experience.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Data Prefetch Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Prefetching of data on hover, lazy loading of components, and skeleton states did not display correctly during load as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Email campaign template created successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The email campaign template creation, modification, sending, or delivery/tracking verification did not succeed as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC019-Security Audit - Cross-Tenant Data Leak and Privilege Escalation Prevention
description: Verify the system prevents data leaks between tenants and does not allow privilege escalation beyond assigned roles.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Try to scroll or reload page to find login inputs or identify alternative input elements
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Unauthorized Tenant Data Access Attempt Detected').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test failed: The system did not prevent data leaks between tenants or privilege escalation as required by the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
